CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?
How many outer arcs are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc Herman Research Center?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc Herman Research Center is arc {Fleming-Rosario Academy}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc Williams University?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc Williams University is arc {Fleming-Rosario Academy}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Williams University} has the largest output flow.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Herman Research Center} has the largest input flow.

VE.Q: What is the flow value from Royal Academy to Alex Laboratory in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Royal Academy to Fleming-Rosario Academy in the chord chart?

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value between Herman Research Center and Alex Laboratory in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between Herman Research Center and Alex Laboratory is {54}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between Alex Laboratory and Herman Research Center in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value between Alex Laboratory and Herman Research Center is {11}.

What is the minimum flow value in the chord chart?

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from Royal Academy?
SC.A: The total flow output from Royal Academy is {94}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by Williams University?
SC.A: The total flow input by Williams University is {75}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 55? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {56} from {Williams University} to {Herman Research Center}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 10? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {6} from {Alex Laboratory} to {Royal Academy}, a flow of {9} from {Williams University} to {Alex Laboratory}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 25 and 43? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {27} from {Fleming-Rosario Academy} to {Royal Academy}, a flow of {40} from {Fleming-Rosario Academy} to {Alex Laboratory}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from Herman Research Center to Williams University or from Fleming-Rosario Academy to Alex Laboratory?
NC.A: The flow from {Fleming-Rosario Academy} to {Alex Laboratory} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Alex Laboratory to Royal Academy, from Alex Laboratory to Williams University, or from Williams University to Alex Laboratory?
NC.A: The flow from {Alex Laboratory} to {Williams University} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {Royal Academy}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {Herman Research Center} and {Williams University}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc Herman Research Center, Arc Williams University, Arc Alex Laboratory, Arc Fleming-Rosario Academy, Arc Royal Academy}.
